item.title: What We're Learning
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.98 ## 3rd Qu.

item.title: About Me
item.description: About Me Canadian born, I was raise North of Dallas in Frisco, Texas. Having found a passion for taking care of animals early on, I have been driven throughout my education by the motivation to attend veterinary school and become a wildlife rescue veterinarian. Interests In my free time, I enjoying all things nature. From hiking and biking, I love being outside. In addition, I run enjoy running half marathons and triathlons.

item.title: Education
item.description: Education I have attended the University of Texas at Austin, where I will obtain a Bachelors in Science and Art in the Fall of 2019. My degree was focused in Biology with a study equivalent to a minor in Psychology. I have also received a Pre-Health Professions Certificate during this time. Skills I have a base level knowledge of R Studio and Python.

item.title: Exploratory Data Analysis
item.description: TeenPregnancy <- read.csv("https://vincentarelbundock.github.io/Rdatasets/csv/Stat2Data/TeenPregnancy.csv") Election16 <- read.csv("https://vincentarelbundock.github.io/Rdatasets/csv/Stat2Data/Election16.csv") ##Intro ###Teen Pregnancy This dataset shows rates of teenage girls pregnant per 1000 teenage girls in each state. It also has variables for Civil War role (i.e. whether that state was a border, confederate, union, or other) and for percent of people who attened church in the previous week from that state. This dataset had interesting variables that I thought would compare well to an election.

item.title: Modeling, Testing, and Predicting
item.description: Calling Dataset and Tidying Before Using library(dplyr);library(tidyverse) TeenPregnancy<-read.csv( "https://vincentarelbundock.github.io/Rdatasets/csv/Stat2Data/TeenPregnancy.csv") Election16<-read.csv( "https://vincentarelbundock.github.io/Rdatasets/csv/Stat2Data/Election16.csv") TeenPregnancy<-dplyr::select(TeenPregnancy, -c(X)) %>%glimpse() ## Observations: 50 ## Variables: 4 ## $ State <fct> AK, AL, AR, AZ, CA, CO, CT, DE, FL, GA, HI, IA, ID, IL, IN, KS, KY, LA, MA, MD, … ## $ CivilWar <fct> O, C, C, O, U, O, U, U, C, C, O, U, O, U, U, U, B, C, U, U, U, U, U, B, C, O, C,… ## $ Church <int> 26, 46, 45, 33, 28, 25, 25, 35, 32, 39, 25, 32, 34, 32, 35, 33, 41, 46, 22, 31, … ## $ Teen <int> 64, 62, 73, 60, 59, 50, 44, 67, 60, 64, 65, 44, 47, 57, 53, 53, 62, 69, 37, 57, … Election16<-dplyr::select(Election16, -c(X, State)) colnames(Election16)[colnames(Election16)=="Abr"]<-"State" glimpse(Election16) ## Observations: 50 ## Variables: 7 ## $ State <fct> AL, AK, AZ, AR, CA, CO, CT, DE, FL, GA, HI, ID, IL, IN, IA, KS, KY, LA, ME, MD, … ## $ Income <int> 43623, 72515, 50255, 41371, 61818, 60629, 70331, 60509, 47507, 49620, 69515, 475… ## $ HS <dbl> 84.

item.title: Work Experience
item.description: Work Experience I have worked as a kennel technician for over 350 hours at the Legacy Veterinary Hospital in Frisco, Texas, practicing skills such as medicating, expressing anal glands, and nail trims. I have worked as a technicians’ assistant since April of 2019 for Crestview Veterinary Clinic in Austin, Texas.
